summary:
The American Mafia, also known as the Italian-American Mafia or simply "the Mob," is a powerful criminal organization with roots in Italian immigrant communities. It started in places like New York, Chicago, and New Orleans in the late 1800s and early 1900s. These groups, including Sicilian Mafiosi, joined to form the modern American Mafia. They call themselves "Cosa Nostra," meaning "our thing."

The Mafia is most active in the Northeast and Midwest, with major families in New York, Chicago, and other cities. They control various illegal activities and have a strong hold on organized crime in the United States, even though other crime groups are growing.
title: American Mafia
